Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I can try to make it be able to handle multiple streams at once its not impossible

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: as each chunk has the first txid at the start, you can identify the stream you want by that txid, and ignore any txs in the block that are not OP_RETURN starting with that

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but I didnt think it would need to handle more than 1 stream at a time

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: It could work that way

Author: daemonfox#6136

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: submit in order

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes

Author: daemonfox#6136

Author: daemonfox#6136

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
this is the current process:
1) send TxBlast RPC to marketmaker to activate stream (time out, name ext included in this call)
2) send hexstring with another RPC on a diffrent RPC port
3) when the TxBlast loop sees data it sends it

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: so is this concept 1 stream per chain or would each chainhave child streams?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Each chain can have multiple streams one after the other

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but not at the same time

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: ok

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: But it doesnt need to be like that... however

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: you could just use an oracle

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: on the streamer chain

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: for other data

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: that would handle all kinds of shit that this limitation does not have

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: This is for very large data

Author: daemonfox#6136
Content: what is an Oracle in the KMD sense?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It allows putting off chain data on chain.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Combined with the single miner ondemand blocks of -ac_stream=1 chain I think it would do what you want
